intro: Macroclinium junctum, commonly known as the jointed macroclinium, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to red. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth surface, while its stems are often branched and somewhat woody at the base. Macroclinium junctum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments in its natural habitat.
